long long next_i(long long current) {

    char s[20];

    sprintf(s, "%lld", current);

    int len = strlen(s);

    // process in reverse order (from s[len-1] down to s[0])

    char transformed[20]; // enough space?

    int f =0;

    int pos =0;

    for (int j=0; j < len; j++) {

        char c = s[len-1 -j]; // the j-th character from the end (starting at last character)

        if (!f) {

            if (c == '3') {

                transformed[pos++] = '5';

                f=1;

            } else if (c == '5') {

                transformed[pos++] = '7';

                f=1;

            } else {

                transformed[pos++] = '3';

            }

        } else {

            transformed[pos++] = c;

        }

    }

    // check if f is still 0 → append '3'

    if (!f) {

        transformed[pos++] = '3';

    }

    transformed[pos] = '\0';

    // now reverse transformed to get the next i.

    char reversed[20];

    int len_t = pos;

    for (int k=0; k < len_t; k++) {

        reversed[k] = transformed[len_t -1 -k];

    }

    reversed[len_t] = '\0';

    // convert to long long

    return atoll(reversed);

}
